spirit:addressBlock.spirit:name: some_register_map
spirit:addressBlock.spirit:description: This address map contains some example registers to show how RDL can be utilized in various situations.

spirit:field.spirit:name: REV_ID
spirit:field.spirit:description: revision id

spirit:field.spirit:name: CHIP_ID
spirit:field.spirit:description: chip id

spirit:field.spirit:name: REMAP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: ddr shadow re-map enable default to set if <var processor: comm> is selected to boot from chip reset. ddr memory shadow is removed if this bit and the corresponding bit from <var processor: ap> is cleared.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SLBTCMSB0
spirit:field.spirit:description: b1tcm selection 1 = use most significant bit of btcm address to select b1tcm 0 = use bit [3] of the btcm address

spirit:field.spirit:name: NCPUHALT0
spirit:field.spirit:description: processor halt after reset 1 = processor starts fetching instructions from reset vector address in normal way 0 = while the processor is in reset, it stops fetching and executing instructions after coming out of reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGNMFI0
spirit:field.spirit:description: nonmaskable fi enable 1 = enable nonmaskable fast interrupts reflected in the nmfi field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: LOCZRAMA0
spirit:field.spirit:description: tcm location 1 = indicates atcm initial base address is 0 and btcm base address is defined by implementation 0 = indicates btcm initial base address is 0 and atcm base address is defined by implementation

spirit:field.spirit:name: INITRAMB0
spirit:field.spirit:description: btcm0 enable reset value of btcm bit 1 = indicates tightly-coupled memory b, btcm, is enabled at reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: INITRAMA0
spirit:field.spirit:description: atcm0 enable reset value of atcm enable bit 1 = indicates tightly-coupled memory a, atcm, is enabled at reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: VINITHI0
spirit:field.spirit:description: vector init high if this processor is selected to boot from chip reset, this field gets its value from strap input. otherwise (if this processor is not selected to boot from chip reset): 0 = vector table placed low 1 = vector table placed high

spirit:field.spirit:name: TEINIT
spirit:field.spirit:description: reset te-bit value determines exception handling state at reset 0 = arm 1 = thumb

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGIE
spirit:field.spirit:description: instruction side endianness 1 = indicates that big endian instruction fetch is used

spirit:field.spirit:name: CFGEE
spirit:field.spirit:description: reset ee-bit value 1 = indicates implementation uses be-8 mode for exceptions at reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: SW_USE44
spirit:field.spirit:description: sw usage this field is used by software.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SP_BRANCH
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: secure> branch this field is used in rom to determine the secure core branch.

spirit:field.spirit:name: SW_USE46
spirit:field.spirit:description: sw usage this field is used by software.

spirit:register.spirit:name: CP_CPU_SRAM_SPD
spirit:register.spirit:description: <var Processor: Comm> CPU SRAM Speed Config Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ITAG_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 i-cache tag sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: ITAG_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 i-cache tag sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: IDATA_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 i-cache data read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: IDATA_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 i-cache data write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDIRTY_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 d-cache dirty read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDIRTY_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 d-cache dirty write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: DTAG_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 d-cache tag sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: DTAG_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 d-cache tag sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDATA_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 d-cache data sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: DDATA_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l1 d-cache data sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: BTCM_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: btcm sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: BTCM_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: btcm sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: ATCM_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: atcm sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: ATCM_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: atcm sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: BTCM_DLY
spirit:field.spirit:description: btcm sram delay cycle this field defines how many cycles to get read data from the sram after a read request is active. as a result, sram is able to run at a lower frequency compared with the <var processor: comm> core. 0x0 = no delay 0x1 = read data avaliable after 1 pclk cycle of read request 0x2 = read data available after 2 pclk cycles of read request 0x3 = read data avaliable after 3 pclk cycles of read request

spirit:field.spirit:name: ATCM_DLY
spirit:field.spirit:description: atcm sram delay cycle this field defines how many cycles to get read data from the sram after a read request is active. as a result, sram is able to run at a lower frequency compared with the <var processor: comm> core. 0x0 = no delay 0x1 = read data avaliable after 1 pclk cycle of read request 0x2 = read data available after 2 pclk cycles of read request 0x3 = read data avaliable after 3 pclk cycles of read request

spirit:register.spirit:name: CR5_PPX_CONF
spirit:register.spirit:description: <var Processor: Comm> AXI Peripheral Interface Configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: PPXBASE0
spirit:field.spirit:description: base address of axi peripheral interface must be size aligned

spirit:field.spirit:name: INITPPX0
spirit:field.spirit:description: axi peripheral interface enable indicates whether the axi peripheral interface is enabled when out of reset 0x0 = disabled 0x1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: PPXSIZE079
spirit:field.spirit:description: base address of axi peripheral interface 0x3 = 4 kb 0x4 = 8 kb 0x5 = 16 kb 0x6 = 32 kb 0x7 = 64 kb 0x8 = 128 kb 0x9 = 256 kb 0xa = 512 kb 0xb = 1 mb 0xc = 2 mb 0xd = 4 mb 0xe = 8 mb 0xf = 16 mb 0x10 = 32 mb 0x1 = 64 mb 0x12 = 128 mb 0x13 = 256 mb 0x14 = 512 mb 0x15 = 1 gb 0x16 = 2 gb 0x17 = 4 gb

spirit:register.spirit:name: CR5_PPV_CONF
spirit:register.spirit:description: <var Processor: Comm> Virtual AXI Peripheral Interface Configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: PPVBASE031:12
spirit:field.spirit:description: base address of virtual axi peripheral interface must be size aligned

spirit:field.spirit:name: PPXSIZE088
spirit:field.spirit:description: base address of virtual axi peripheral interface 0x3 = 4 kb 0x4 = 8 kb 0x5 = 16 kb 0x6 = 32 kb 0x7 = 64 kb 0x8 = 128 kb 0x9 = 256 kb 0xa = 512 kb 0xb = 1 mb 0xc = 2 mb 0xd = 4 mb 0xe = 8 mb 0xf = 16 mb 0x10 = 32 mb 0x1 = 64 mb 0x12 = 128 mb 0x13 = 256 mb 0x14 = 512 mb 0x15 = 1 gb 0x16 = 2 gb 0x17 = 4 gb

spirit:register.spirit:name: CP_L2C_ADDR_FILTER_CONF
spirit:register.spirit:description: <var Processor: Comm> L2 Cache Address Filter Config Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_FILTER_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: address filter enable 0 = disable 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_FILTER_END31:20
spirit:field.spirit:description: address filter end address

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_FILTER_START31:20
spirit:field.spirit:description: address filter start address

spirit:field.spirit:name: SC2_QOS_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: sc2 to memory controller axi qos select 1 = sc2 qos is controlled by the sc2 module itself by default, sc2 qos is controlled by the <camera to memory controller axi qos> field

spirit:field.spirit:name: DC4_QOS_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: dc4 to memory controller axi qos select 1 = dc4 qos is controlled by the dc4 module itself by default, dc4 qos is controlled by the <lcd to memory controller axi qos> field

spirit:field.spirit:name: VPU_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: vpu to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: LCD_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: lcd to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: DRAGON_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: app> to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: comm> to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: GC_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: 2d/3d gpu to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: ISP_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: camera to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: LTEDMA_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: ltedma to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: WTM_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: wtm to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: USB_DEV_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 2 to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: DTC_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: dtc (fabric 1 s5) to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_AXI_QOS_S5
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma (fabric 1 s5) to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: MSA_AXI_QOS
spirit:field.spirit:description: msa (fabric 1 s5) to memory controller axi qos 0x3 = critical 0x2 = high 0x1= low 0x0 = low

spirit:field.spirit:name: RPMB
spirit:field.spirit:description: rpmb bit (fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: DOWN_KEY_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: download key disable bit (fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: EMMC_CLK_SRC
spirit:field.spirit:description: emmc clock source bit (fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: EMMC_PHY
spirit:field.spirit:description: emmc phy bypass bit (fuse and strap pin ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: EMMC_DIV
spirit:field.spirit:description: emmc timing divider bits (fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: TIMER_FREQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: timer freq bits (fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: TIMER_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: timer mode bits(fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: ENCRYPT_BOOT
spirit:field.spirit:description: encrypted boot bit (fuse and strap pin ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: ANTI_ROLLBACK
spirit:field.spirit:description: anti roll back bit (fuse and strap pin ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: BOOTROM_OPER_MODE
spirit:field.spirit:description: bootrom operation mode, only controlled by strap pin

spirit:field.spirit:name: DISABLE_DFT_SCAN
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit0 disable dft scan, which can be opened by keycertificate, bit1 disable dft scan forever. (fuse ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: DISABLE_AP_JTAG
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit0 disable ap jtag, which can be opened by keycertificate, bit1 disable ap jtag forever. (fuse and strap pin ctrl)

spirit:field.spirit:name: BRANCH_ADDR
spirit:field.spirit:description: branch address this field is used by software to set the branch address for cpus.

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_REGFILEBASE31:12
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache register base address

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_BEARLYEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache write early response enable 0 = early write response of <var processor: comm> l2 cache is not alllowed 1 = early write response of <var processor: comm> l2 cache is alllowed (by setting the early bresp enable bit in the auxiliary control register, bit[30])

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_CFGBIGEND
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache big endian enable 1 = enable big endian mode for accessing configuration registers out of reset 0 = enable little endian mode for accessing configuration registers out of reset

spirit:register.spirit:name: CP_L2C_SRAM_CONF
spirit:register.spirit:description: <var Processor: Comm> L2C SRAM Timing Configuration Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_TAG_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache tag sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_TAG_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache tag sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_DATA_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache data sram read timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_L2C_DATA_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: l2 cache data sram write timing

spirit:field.spirit:name: BROM_IPC0
spirit:field.spirit:description: boot rom ipc x this field stores information for the boot rom.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_WDB_STATUS
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller wdb empty status

spirit:field.spirit:name: CAP_FAB_ACLKM0_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: app> fabric m0 port axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: CAP_FAB_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: app> fabric axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: FBRC2_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric2 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: FBRC1_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric1 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: CSAP_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: csap fabric axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: SP_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: sp fabric axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_DCLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller dclk gating enable 1 = disable hardware dynamic gating 0 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: FBRC1_CP_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric1 cp axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FBRC1_AP_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric1 ap axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_FAB_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: comm> fabric1x2 clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P7_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p7 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P6_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p6 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P5_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p5 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P4_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p4 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P3_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p3 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P2_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p2 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P1_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p1 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_P0_ACLK_GATE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: mc p0 axi clock dynamic gating enable 0 = disable hardware dynamic gating 1 = enable hardware dynamic gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_PHY_RST_MASK
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller axi port clock gating disable 1=disable dynamic clock gating, free running aclk 0=enable dynamic clock gating

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_PHY_DLL_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller phy dll disable this field disables the soc override to the memory controller phy dll.

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_WDB_DRAIN_REQ
spirit:field.spirit:description: used for debug only. sw don't touch

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_PDFVSSM
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller pdfvssm

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_PDLVMC
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller pdlvmc

spirit:field.spirit:name: MC_PDWN
spirit:field.spirit:description: memory controller pdwn

spirit:register.spirit:name: TOP_MEM_RTC_WTC_SPD
spirit:register.spirit:description: App Top Memory RTC/WTC Speed Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_AXI_MEM_WTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma axi memory wtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_AXI_MEM_RTC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma axi memory rtc

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUDIO_SW_ATRESETN
spirit:field.spirit:description: audio software atresetn 0 = software atresetn issued to audio atclk domain logic

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUDIO_SW_PRESETDBGN
spirit:field.spirit:description: audio software presetdbgn 0 = software presetdbgn issued to audio pclkdbg domain logic

spirit:field.spirit:name: ETF_PDWN
spirit:field.spirit:description: etf sram powerdown parameter this field defines the pdwn value for etb memory.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ETF_EMAW
spirit:field.spirit:description: etf sram emaw parameter this field defines the emaw value for etb memory.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ETF_EMA
spirit:field.spirit:description: etf sram ema parameter this field defines the ema value for etb memory.

spirit:field.spirit:name: TPIUPMAX
spirit:field.spirit:description: tpiu data out bit width this field defines the data width for tpiu trace data out.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DBGEN254
spirit:field.spirit:description: invasive debug enable 0 = not enabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPIDEN255
spirit:field.spirit:description: secure privileged invasive debug enable 0 = not enabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPNIDEN256
spirit:field.spirit:description: secure non-invasive debug enable 0 = not enabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: NIDEN257
spirit:field.spirit:description: non-invasive debug enable 0 = not enabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: DBGSWENANBLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dbgswenanble this field is asserted to block system access to the debug register file through the memory-mapped and extended cp14 interfaces.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DAP_APB_SECURE_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: dap secure protection enable 0 = both secure and non-secure apb transaction are able to access dap 1 = only secure apb transaction is able to access dap

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMC_AWURGENT
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: awurgent=0, 1: awurgent=1 each bit indicate an axi port of dmc

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMC_ARURGENT
spirit:field.spirit:description: 0: arurgent=0, 1: arurgent=1 each bit indicate an axi port of dmc be careful of the use of this bit, it would break the arbitration policy in dmc and may make total performance worse

spirit:field.spirit:name: PMU_SEC_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: pmu secure write enable when this bit is set, the pmu wtm clk/rst register only can be written by secured <var processor: app> or <var processor: secure>

spirit:field.spirit:name: I2C8_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: i2c8 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: I2C7_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: i2c7 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: I2C5_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: i2c5 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SSP2_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: ssp2 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: DIS_PREADY_SEL
spirit:field.spirit:description: disable pready sel for cp and audio apb (for debug)

spirit:field.spirit:name: GEC_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: genric counter secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SEL_SSK_AES_KEY
spirit:field.spirit:description: select key for aes engine inside bcm (1:ssk key 0:aes key

spirit:field.spirit:name: XM4_SQU_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: xm4 dtcm (squ) secure

spirit:field.spirit:name: KEYPAD_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: keypad secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: I2C3_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: i2c3 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SEC_RTC_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: sec rtc (0xd4010400) secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: SSP0_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: ssp0 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: NDR_TIMER_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: pmu ndr timer with watchdog secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: TIMER1_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: timer1 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: UART1_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: uart1 secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: NONSEC_AP_2_XM4_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: non-sec ap can't access xm4 registers if this bit is set to 1 (except for xm4 dtcm)

spirit:field.spirit:name: XM4_2_ISP_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: xm4 can't access isp if this bit is set to 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: ISP_2_XM4_DIS
spirit:field.spirit:description: isp can't access xm4 if this bit is set to 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUDIO_SLAVE_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: audio system as a slave works in secure mode, only secure master can access audio subsystem

spirit:field.spirit:name: AUDIO_MASTER_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: audio system as a axi/apb master works in secure mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: CP_SEC
spirit:field.spirit:description: <var processor: comm> secure enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: DMA_SEC_CH
spirit:field.spirit:description: dma secure channels each bit in this register corresponds to a bit for each channel when dma is working in secure mode. (dma has 16 channels, and each bit for one channel) 1= related channel is secure 0 = related channel is non-secure

spirit:field.spirit:name: FPID_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable fpid for tzc, each bit for one tzc port

spirit:field.spirit:name: FUSE_READ_CLK_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fuse read clock enable this field is used to enable the signal for fuse read state machine.

spirit:field.spirit:name: FUSE_READ_CLK_DIV_VAL
spirit:field.spirit:description: fuse read clock divider value the clock divider value is used to select the clock frequency of the fuse serial clock. 0x0 = clock = pm_vctcxo clock /1024 0x1 = clock = pm_vctcxo clock / 512 0x2 = pm_vctcxo clock = pm_vctcxo clock / 256 0x3 = clock = pm_vctcxo clock / 32 0x4 = clock = pm_vctcxo clock / 4 other = clock = pm_vctcxo clock / 8

spirit:field.spirit:name: UP_4G
spirit:field.spirit:description: if ddr device is less than 4g, can set this bit to 1'b0 to map 0x1_0000_0000 to 0x1_ffff_ffff system addr to 0x0000_0000 to 0xffff_ffff in ddr controller side. the default value of this bit is 1'b1 (doesn't remap)

spirit:field.spirit:name: GPU_POSTED_WRSP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: gpu posted write response enable 1 = 2d/3d gpu can generate posted write transactions to the mcb for faster write response generation 0 = mcb will consider all write transactions from 2d/3d gpu as non-posted

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC2_S7_POSTED_WRSP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 2 s7 posted write response enable 1 = fabric2 s7 can generate posted write transactions to the mcb for faster write response generation 0 = mcb will consider all write transactions from fabric2 s7 port as non-posted

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC1_S5_POSTED_WRSP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 1 s5 posted write response enable 1 = fabric1 s5 port can generate posted write transactions to the mcb for faster write response generation 0 = mcb will consider all write transactions from fabric 1 port s5 as non-posted

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC1_S0_POSTED_WRSP_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 1 s0 posted write response enable 1 = fabric1 s0 port can generate posted write transactions to the mcb for faster write response generation 0 = mcb will consider all write transactions from fabric 1 port s0 as non-posted

spirit:field.spirit:name: GC_FAST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: 2d/3d gpu fast enable when enabled, 2d/3d gpu will access mcb/memory controller fast queue 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC1_S5_FAST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 1 s5 fast enable when enabled, fabric1 s5 port will access mcb/memory controller fast queue 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC1_S0_FAST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 1 s0 fast enable when enabled, fabric1 s0 port will access mcb/mc fast queue 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC2_VPU_FAST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 2 vpu fast enable when enabled, video vpu master on fabric 2 will access mcb/mc fast queue 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC2_USB1_FAST_EN339
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 2 usb2 fast enable when enabled, usb2 master on fabric 2 will access mcb/mc fast queue 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC2_SD_FAST_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: fabric 2 sd fast enable when enabled, sd master on fabric 2 will access mcb/mc fast queue 1 = enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: FABRIC2_USB1_FAST_EN341

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_CODE_INIT_RDY
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss ready for code initialization 1 = ready 0 = not ready

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_CODE_INIT_DONE
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss code initialization complete 1 = complete 0 = not complete

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_SQU_SA
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss squ start address this field is the start address of squ area pre-allocated for gnss m3 use. the pre-allocated area must be 8 kb-aligned, and the lower 13-bit must be ignored. if the end address is equal to the start address, the 8 kb starting from the start address is allocated for gnss m3 use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_SQU_EA
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss squ end address this field is the end address of squ area pre-allocated for gnss m3 use. the pre-allocated area must be 8 kb-aligned, and the lower 13-bit must be ignored. if the end address is equal to the start address, the 8 kb starting from the start address is allocated for gnss m3 use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_DDR_SA
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss ddr start address this field is the start address of ddr area pre-allocated for gnss m3 use. the pre-allocated area must be 16 mb-aligned, and the lower 24-bit must be ignored. if the end address is equal to the start address, the 16 mb starting from the start address is allocated for gnss m3 use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_DDR_EA
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss ddr end address this field is the end address of ddr area pre-allocated for gnss m3 use. the pre-allocated area must be 16 mb-aligned, and the lower 24-bit must be ignored. if the end address is equal to the start address, the 16mb starting from the start address is allocated for gnss m3 use.

spirit:register.spirit:name: GNSS_DMA_DDR_START_ADDR
spirit:register.spirit:description: GNSS DMA DDR Start Address Register

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_DMA_DDR_SA
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss dma ddr start address this field is the start address of ddr area pre-allocated for gnss dma use. the pre-allocated area must be 16 mb-aligned, and the lower 24-bit must be ignored. if the end address is equal to the start address, the 16 mb starting from the start address is allocated for gnss dma use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_DMA_DDR_EA
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss dma ddr end address this field is the end address of ddr area pre-allocated for gnss dma use. the pre-allocated area must be 16 mb-aligned, and the lower 24-bit must be ignored. if the end address is equal to the start address, the 16 mb starting from the start address is allocated for gnss dma use.

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_IRQ_OUT_ST
spirit:field.spirit:description: gnss module interrupt request status 1 = gnss interrupt is pending 0 = no gnss interrupt is pending

spirit:field.spirit:name: GNSS_IRQ_CLR
spirit:field.spirit:description: application processor acknowledges interrupt from gnss it can only be asserted when the interrupt from gnss is active. it is cleared by hardware when gnss get an acknowledge from the application processor and de-asserts the interrupt. 1 = application processor gets interrupt and is about to clear it 0 = no handshake

spirit:field.spirit:name: AP_GNSS_WAKEUP
spirit:field.spirit:description: application processor sends wake-up event to gnss it will be cleared by hardware when gnss acknowledges the event. 1= wake-up event generated 0 = wake-up event not generated

spirit:register.spirit:name: MC_ADDR_HASH_EN

spirit:field.spirit:name: ADDR_HASH_EN

spirit:field.spirit:name: HASH_EN
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit0 0: hash disable, 1: hash enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: DVMENABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: dvm messabe enable 1=enable 0=disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: QOSOVERRIDE
spirit:field.spirit:description: cci qos override 1 = internally-generated values override the arqos and awqos inputs

spirit:field.spirit:name: ACCHANNELEN
spirit:field.spirit:description: cci ac request enable 0 = ac requests are never issued on the corresponding cci slave interface

spirit:field.spirit:name: SYSBARDISABLE
spirit:field.spirit:description: disable broadcasting of barriers onto system bus 0 = barriers are broadcast onto system bus 1 = barriers are not broadcast onto the system bus. this pin is sampled only during reset of the cortex-a53 processor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BROADCASTOUTER
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable broadcasting of outer shareable transactions 0 = outer shareable transactions are not broadcast externally 1 = outer shareable transactions are broadcast externally this pin is sampled only during reset of <var processor: app>.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BROADCASTINNER
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable broadcasting of inner shareable transactions 0 = inner shareable transactions are not broadcast externally 1 = inner shareable transactions are broadcast externally if broadcastinner is tied high, broadcastouter must also be tied high. this pin is sampled only during reset.

spirit:field.spirit:name: BROADCASTCACHEMAINT
spirit:field.spirit:description: enable broadcasting of cache maintenance operations to downstream caches 0 = cache maintenance operations are not broadcast to downstream caches 1 = cache maintenance operations are broadcast to downstream caches this pin is sampled only during reset.

spirit:field.spirit:name: DBGEN889
spirit:field.spirit:description: invasive debug enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: NIDEN890
spirit:field.spirit:description: non-invasive debug enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPIDEN891
spirit:field.spirit:description: secure privileged invasive debug enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: SPNIDEN892
spirit:field.spirit:description: secure privileged non-invasive debug enable 0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: VINITHI894
spirit:field.spirit:description: vector init high if this processor is selected to boot from chip reset, this field gets its value from strap input. otherwise (if this processor is not selected to boot from chip reset): 0 = vector table placed low 1 = vector table placed high (only this option is supported)

spirit:field.spirit:name: CI_STATE_HOLD_CTRL960
spirit:field.spirit:description: controlling bit of holding the registers' contents after functional reset. 0 = the registers will not update the status in real time and the values in the registers are not valid. 1 = the registers will be updated to the read state in time. once reset is asserted, the state_hold_ctrl[0] will be cleared and the registers will hold the values just before reset.
